author: sharon seidler

review: This is a very cool gadget at a good price! I love that I can hook it up SO easily and use my iphone, ipad, computer etc to control it. I can start watching a movie in one room and then move to another room/tv where I also have a Chromecast set up and finish watching it! I got 5 of these and have them in two of my homes and multiple TVs (I think I could actually just move one from TV to TV but I'm lazy :)  My only complaint, and the reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is that it doesn't work with Amazon Prime movies. And my sister says a Roku has many more possibilities. But it's less expensive and easier than the Roku so I think I'll keep them.
author: Amy L. Goyer

review: I have both a Chromecast and a slightly older Roku 2 (I think... not completely sure about the exact model -- I bought in October, 2012). And right now, I think the Roku is slightly better as it offers more content not available on Chromecast. But I have a feeling that Chromecast will catch up very soon.For someone who just wants to stream Netflix and Pandora to their TV, this is highly recommended. I told my parents to buy one for just that purpose and they really like it. They really like just starting a movie or radio station from their tablet instead of searching for a remote. The picture is great, set up is extremely easy, and everyone is happy.While I would put the Roku slightly ahead of this device for now (I don't have AppleTV so I can't comment on its quality relative to these devices) the fact that Chromecast recently made its SDK public for new content makes me excited to see where this thing is going. And with the deep pockets of Google, if they really want to throw some weight behind this thing, I think it could be incredibly awesome. I'm anxious to see what the Android community comes up with for this in the near future and excited to see where Google might eventually take this.For $35, this thing is very much worth it. And given a little bit of time and some talented developers, thing could become extremely awesome in the very near future.
